definition: bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
to wind/to tighten/crescent moon/first quarter or waxing moon
to sing to a string accompaniment/education (a reference to teaching the people Confucian values by means of song in ancient times)
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony

sentences.english: However, it is that absence of proof that is perhaps most damning.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏实验证明也许是弦理论最致命之处。

sentences.english: Large-span suspended-dome was adopted in Ji nan Olympic Center Gymnasium.
sentences.chinese: 济南奥体中心体育馆采用大跨度弦支穹顶结构。

sentences.english: She played the main part of the songs on the lowest guitar strings.
sentences.chinese: 她弹吉他弦上最低的歌曲的主要部分。

sentences.english: The head bounds the stringed area.
sentences.chinese: 拍头是有弦区域的边界。

sentences.english: A string skims across the sky.
Computes the arcsine of the specified argument.
sentences.chinese: 计算指定参数的反正弦。

sentences.english: He was like a taut string; you can play the notes from time to time.
sentences.chinese: 他像是一根绷紧的弦，时不时可以弹奏出音符。

sentences.english: Er-hu virtuosi can play even the most complex violin pieces with two strings.
sentences.chinese: 二胡大师能用两根弦拉最复杂的小提琴曲。

sentences.english: He ordered all the port cannon to be heaved to starboard to counteract the list.
sentences.chinese: 他命令把左弦上所有的大炮移到右舷以抵消船的倾斜。

sentences.english: Fast and accurate computation of the arcsine function in a modern engineering has been used widely.
sentences.chinese: 快速精确的反正弦函数运算在现代工程中应用广泛。

sentences.english: The top chords will be designed with a temporary bolted splice at mid-span.
sentences.chinese: 设计顶部弦杆时，应在跨距中间有一临时螺栓铰接。

sentences.english: In normal staccato, gravity quickly returns the damper onto the strings.
sentences.chinese: 在普通断奏中，重力使止音器快速地回到弦上。

sentences.english: Does a violin have four strings?
He keyed up all the strings of his violin before his performance.
sentences.chinese: 他在表演前将小提琴所有的弦都调好了。

sentences.english: Stray birds of suer come to my window to sing and fly away.
sentences.chinese: 夏天的飞鸟，飞到弦的窗前唱歌，又飞去了。

sentences.english: Is the action of nature not unlike drawing a bow?
sentences.chinese: 自然的法则，岂不象弓拉开了弦一样吗？

definition: widowed/lit. broken string, cf 琴瑟[qin2 se4] qin and se, two instruments epitomizing marital harmony
to wind/to tighten/crescent moon/first quarter or waxing moon
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
